NUS President-elect Aaron Porter to fight against lift on tuition fees cap

In an exclusive interview with <em>Nouse</em>, NUS President-elect, Aaron Porter, has emphasised that his top priority this year will be to reject "any possible lifting of the cap on fees" and to "fight for a fairer alternative" (Thumbnail credit Aaron Porter rose from the position of Vice-President for Higher Education to President of NUS last month. Image: CBI Higher Education Summit)

YUSU's affiliation to the National Union of Students (NUS) is viewed by YUSU Officers with varying degrees of content

York accommodation fees rise up to 16 per cent above NUS calculations

Earlier this year the National Union of Students (NUS) reported a 22% rise in accommodation costs since the academic year of 2006-2007 (Thumbnail credit Accommodation charges, such as at Alcuin, have risen by up to 38%. Photo: Michael Brunsden)

NUS: 1 in 7 female students sexually assaulted

One in seven female students has been the victim of serious sexual assault or serious physical violence while at university, says a recent National Union of Students (NUS) report

Audio Bullys revealed as headliners of Big D

The annual campus festival, Big D, is to be headlined by Audio Bullys and Chase & Status this year (Thumbnail credit Audio Bullys and Chase &amp; Status will headline this years Big D, along with Reverend Soundsystem. Images: Facebook)

Asbestos in V-Bar prevents new URY equipment

It has been revealed that asbestos present in the walls of V-Bar has caused a halt to plans to install speakers to stream University Radio York (URY) across the space (Thumbnail credit Asbestos has been forced to halt plans to install new speakers. Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Plan for student centre confirmed

The University of York have drafted a Space Strategy plan, outlining the direction in which they would like the University develop in ten or more years time (Thumbnail credit A new student centre is part of the University's Space Strategy. Photo: Sam Newsome)

York scientists make new environmental breakthroughs

Scientists at the University of York have been embarking on a number of new environmental initiatives, which could help reduce the impact of carpet tile waste on the environment and create an alternative biofuel made from household waste (Thumbnail credit Scientists have made new findings. Image: York Press)

YUSU Strategic Plan

Excited you probably aren't, but interested you should be. After months of consultation, Union President Tim Ngwena has released the draft version of YUSU's strategic plan for 2010-2013, claiming that the report "sets the framework for making the right decision in the future."

Confusion over 'No Platform' policies

The University and the National Union of Students (NUS) have conflicted over whether British National Party (BNP) speakers should be permitted on campus

Computer Science Professor awarded

University of York Computer Science Professor, Samuel Braunstein, has been placed number five in the list of the 'Top Ten Physics Newsmakers of the Decade', by the American Physical Society

New treatment for fatal disease found

Scientists at the University of York's Centre for Immunology and Infection have made a breakthrough in treatments for the disease human trypanosomiasis, commonly known as sleeping sickness

YUSU has expressed its concern this week over the lack of a full board of student trustees, which may affect the safeguarding of the Union
